1.text: Proverbs of Solomon, son of David, king of Israel:

2.text: to know wisdom and instruction; to discern the words of understanding;

3.text: to receive the instruction of wisdom, righteousness and judgment, and equity;

4.text: to give prudence to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion.

5.text: He that is wise will hear, and will increase learning; and the intelligent will gain wise counsels:

6.text: to understand a proverb and an allegory, the words of the wise and their enigmas.

7.text: The fear of Jehovah is the beginning of knowledge: fools despise wisdom and instruction.

8.text: Hear, my son, the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the teaching of thy mother;

9.text: for they shall be a garland of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck.

10.text: My son, if sinners entice thee, consent not.

11.text: If they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood, let us lurk secretly for the innocent without cause;

12.text: let us swallow them up alive as Sheol, and whole, as those that go down into the pit;

13.text: we shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil:

14.text: cast in thy lot among us; we will all have one purse:

15.text: —my son, walk not in the way with them, keep back thy foot from their path;

16.text: for their feet run to evil, and they make haste to shed blood.

17.text: For in vain the net is spread in the sight of anything which hath wings.

18.text: And these lay wait for their own blood; they lurk secretly for their own lives.

19.text: So are the paths of every one that is greedy of gain: it taketh away the life of its possessors.

20.text: Wisdom crieth without; she raiseth her voice in the broadways;

21.text: she calleth in the chief [place] of concourse, in the entry of the gates; in the city she uttereth her words:

22.text: How long, simple ones, will ye love simpleness, and scorners take pleasure in their scorning, and the foolish hate knowledge?

23.text: Turn you at my reproof: behold, I will pour forth my spirit unto you, I will make known to you my words.

24.text: Because I have called, and ye refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no one regarded;

25.text: and ye have rejected all my counsel, and would none of my reproof:

26.text: I also will laugh in your calamity, I will mock when your fear cometh;

27.text: when your fear cometh as sudden destruction, and your calamity cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish come upon you:

28.text: —then will they call upon me, but I will not answer; they will seek me early, and shall not find me.

29.text: Because they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of Jehovah;

30.text: they would none of my counsel, they despised all my reproof:

31.text: therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their way, and be filled with their own devices.

32.text: For the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the prosperity of the foolish shall cause them to perish.

33.text: But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be at rest from fear of evil.
